snippet: With a re-election campaign ahead of him, President Hugo Chávez has upended expectations, scattering some close confidants and promoting some old associates.
abstract: Venezuela's Pres Hugo Chavez, who is facing cancer diagnosis as well as a lengthy re-election campaign, upends speculation about his possible successor by removing many of his closest confidants from prominent government positions; promotes several former associates in a way that seems certain to provoke alarm at home and abroad.

byline.contributor: María Eugenia Díaz contributed reporting from Caracas.

lead_paragraph: With a re-election campaign ahead of him, President Hugo Chávez has upended expectations, scattering some close confidants and promoting some old associates.

headline.seo: State of Politics in Venezuela Unsettled by Chávez Appointments
headline.main: Appointments Unsettle State of Venezuelan Politics
headline.print_headline: Appointments Unsettle State of Venezuelan Politics
